alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Chowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BERTIE AND SOUTHWESTERN CHOWAN COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westover, or near Plymouth, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties, including the following locations... Merry Hill, Macedonia, Hancock, Midway, Woodard, and Edenhouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
